snippet: The most intimate and heartbreaking of catastrophes and the insatiable beast of global media are locked in an awkward union in a bucolic New England town that never expected to encounter either.
abstract: Intimate and heartbreaking catastrophes and the appetites of global media are locked in an awkward union in the bucolic New England town of Newtown, Conn, following shooting rampage at Sandy Hook Elementary School; media outlets feel it is important to cover national tragedies, but residents wish they would leave them in peace to grieve and mourn.

byline.original: By PETER APPLEBOME and BRIAN STELTER
byline.contributor: Peter Applebome reported from Newtown, Conn., and Brian Stelter from New York.

lead_paragraph: The most intimate and heartbreaking of catastrophes and the insatiable beast of global media are locked in an awkward union in a bucolic New England town that never expected to encounter either.

headline.seo: Newtown has Mixed Feelings About the Media Horde in Its Midst
headline.main: Media Spotlight Seen as a Blessing, or a Curse, in a Grieving Town
headline.print_headline: Media Spotlight Seen as a Blessing, or a Curse, in a Grieving Town
